alert.note: Alert for Greenville; Spartanburg (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 26 at 8:20PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1130 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of upstate South Carolina, including the following counties, Greenville and Spartanburg. * WHEN...Until 1130 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 817 PM EDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rainfall due to torrential showers and thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen over the past two hours and an additional inch will be possible in locations just southeast of the I-85 corridor. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Greenville Downtown, Greenville Eastside, West Greenville, Greer, Mauldin, Taylors, Simpsonville, Five Forks, Duncan, Lyman, Reidville, and Moore. Flooding is also possible along Rocky Creek, Dillard Creek, Abner Creek, and tributaries to the South Tyger River. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: When it is safe to do so, please report flooding or landslides threatening roads or property to the National Weather Service Greenville-Spartanburg by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, by posting on our Facebook page, or via Twitter using hashtag NWSGSP. Your message should describe the specific location where impacts occurred and the depth of flooding observed. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
